Series 1.question: Which part of a URL indicates the protocol used for accessing a resource on the web?
In web publishing, the role of DNS is to
options: Translate domain names to IP addresses

Series 1.question: Which is the most accurate description of a domain name?
options: A unique numeric label for a device
A human-friendly alias that maps to an IP

Series 1.question: What is the main difference between HTTP and HTTPS in web design context?
options: HTTPS uses encryption (TLS/SSL) for secure communication

Series 1.question: Which of the following is a valid top-level domain (TLD)?
A typical public IPv4 address looks like
Which part of the URL https://www.schoolnet.lk/resources/notes.html is the path?
When hosting a website, a static IP on the server is useful because it
options: Provides a stable address for the domain to map to

Series 1.question: Which protocol is primarily used for transferring files during web deployment?
What is the purpose of a subdomain such as blog.example.com?
options: It identifies a specific section or service within a domain
It is the server’s IP address

Series 1.question: Which organization coordinates global domain name system policies?
In cloud computing, SaaS best matches which description?
options: User manages virtual machines and storage
Provider delivers complete applications over the internet

Series 1.question: Which is a common advantage of deploying a website on cloud hosting?
options: Automatic scalability and global availability options

Series 1.question: Which entry would you typically add at your DNS provider to point a domain to a web server?
Which protocol is used by browsers to request and fetch web pages?
What is the main benefit of using a CDN for a website?
options: Serves content from locations closer to users to reduce latency

Series 1.question: Which statement about IPv6 is true for modern web hosting?
options: It provides a vastly larger address space than IPv4
It cannot be used with HTTPS
It is only for private networks

Series 1.question: Which part of the URL often identifies the specific file or resource, e.g., index.html?
In a typical shared hosting environment, multiple websites
options: Share the same physical server resources

Series 1.question: Which of the following is a likely disadvantage when relying entirely on cloud services for a website?
options: Built-in encryption for all data by default

Series 3.question: What is web hosting in the context of publishing a website?
options: Renting server space to store and serve website files

Series 3.question: Which record type would you modify to point your domain to a new web server IP?
Which is a common step in publishing a static website to a host?
Which is the best description of a content management system (CMS)?
options: A protocol for secure file transfer
A platform to build and manage website content without coding everything manually

Series 3.question: Which statement about responsive web design is true?
options: It only works on desktop screens
It adapts layout to different screen sizes and devices

Series 3.question: Why is alt text important for images on a website?
options: It provides accessibility and text descriptions when images can’t load

Series 3.question: Which hosting type gives you full control over the server configuration?
What is the main purpose of a site map in a website project?
options: To outline website structure and navigation

Series 3.question: Which is a good practice before publishing a website?
options: Validate HTML/CSS and test on multiple browsers/devices

Series 3.question: Which statement about domain registration is true?
options: You register a domain through a registrar for a period (e.g., 1–2 years)
The registrar hosts your files by default
DNS records cannot be changed later

Series 3.question: What is the purpose of an SSL/TLS certificate on a website?
options: To encrypt data in transit and enable HTTPS

Series 3.question: What is version control (e.g., Git) useful for in web projects?
options: Tracking changes to code and collaborating safely

Series 3.question: Which term best describes releasing updates to a limited audience or section first?
Which of the following improves website performance for global users?
options: Using a CDN to cache assets near users

Series 3.question: Why is regular maintenance important after publishing a website?
options: To update content, fix bugs, patch security issues

Series 3.question: Which is a typical step when connecting a custom domain to a hosted site?
options: Edit the A/CNAME records at the registrar or DNS provider

Series 3.question: Which tool helps reduce file sizes of images before upload?
Which is a good practice for file and folder naming on a website?
Which folder typically stores website images in many basic projects?
Which step helps search engines understand your page content?
options: Use relevant titles and meta descriptions
